content: Item 1A. Risk Factors. Our business is subject to rapid technological change, competitive pressures in smartphones, personal computers, wearables, and services, reliance on third-party manufacturing and components, and global economic conditions affecting consumer demand. Disruptions in supply chain logistics, including constraints on semiconductor and display availability, could materially affect product cost and availability. Regulatory developments related to privacy, app store practices, and digital services, as well as trade policies and tariffs, could negatively impact financial performance. Currency fluctuations and geopolitical instability may also adversely affect revenue and margins.

Item 1A. Risk Factors. Demand for cloud services and enterprise software may slow due to macroeconomic conditions. Intense competition in cloud, productivity software, and AI services could pressure pricing and margins. Cybersecurity threats, including nation-state attacks, present ongoing risks to service availability and customer trust. Changes in AI regulation, data privacy, export controls, and antitrust enforcement may affect product roadmaps and market access. Supply chain constraints for data center hardware and energy availability could impact capacity expansions.
